title: 12 killed, 50 wounded

title: 6 killed, 3 wounded
description: Artillery fire hits people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City. Initial casualty reports said two or three killed and "several" or more than 10 wounded. The number killed was later reported as six. We recorded six killed and three wounded because we couldn't verify the report of more than 10 wounded.

title: International Court of Justice provisional measures order
description: The ICJ orders Israel to "take all measures within its power to prevent" genocide in Gaza, and to "take immediate and effective measures" to enable the delivery of humanitarian aid. The order is part of the case brought by South Africa accusing Israel of committing genocide in Gaza.

description: Israeli troops fired on people waiting for an aid convoy near Beit Hanoun. Sources report one to six killed and a number wounded. We recorded one killed and two wounded.

title: International Court of Justice second provisional measure order
description: The International Court of Justice issued a second provisional measure order in the case brought by South Africa accusing Israel of committing genocide in Gaza. In addition to the measures ordered in January, the court called on Israel to "take all necessary and effective measures to ensure, without delay, in full co-operation with the United Nations, the unhindered provision at scale by all concerned of urgently needed basic services and humanitarian assistance, including food, water, electricity, fuel, shelter, clothing, hygiene and sanitation requirements, as well as medical supplies and medical care to Palestinians throughout Gaza".

title: 6 killed
description: Israeli gunfire and shelling hit people waiting for aid in Shuja'iyya, Gaza City.

title: 7 wounded
description: In the first of two incidents on the same day, Israeli troops fired on people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City.

title: 12 killed, 30 wounded
description: In a second incident, Israeli troops fired on people securing an aid convoy and waiting crowds near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City. Sources report at least 12 people killed.
sources:
ACLED
Wafa
Al Jazeera
Al Jazeera

title: World Central Kitchen killings
description: Israeli drones strikes targeted a three-car convoy from the World Central Kitchen, killing seven aid workers. Six of those killed were from Western countries, and one was Palestinian. International condemnation over the killings put pressure on Israel to faciliate aid deliveries and to do more to protect aid workers and people recieving aid.

title: 4 killed
description: Israeli troops fired on people waiting for aid near the Kuwait Roundabout in Gaza City.

title: 2 wounded
description: Israeli troops fired on people waiting for aid west of Beit Lahia. Multiple people wounded, according to sources. We recorded two.
sources:
ACLED
Al Jazeera
Anas Al-Sharif
Safa

title: Erez West/Zikim crossing in northern Gaza opens
description: Israel allows a humanitarian convoy to enter Gaza through the northern Erez West/Zikim border crossing for the first time since the beginning of the war. The opening of the crossing is officially announced on 12 May. However, Israeli authorities only allow small amounts of aid to enter, and aid groups aren't able to transport supplies entering through the north to the south of Gaza, where the majority of the enclave's population has been displaced.

title: 1 killed, 2 wounded
description: Israeli forces fired on an aid convoy shortly after it entered northern Gaza, killing a driver. Artillery hit the area shortly after. In addition to the driver who was killed, sources say a number of people were wounded. We recorded two.
sources:
ACLED
NewPress
Quds
Quds
Quds

title: Invasion of Rafah
description: Israel launches a full-scale ground invasion of Rafah, the southernmost city in Gaza. Rafah had become a refuge for over 1 million Palestinians displaced from other parts of Gaza. The city was also the logistics and operations hub for international aid organisations. During the invasion, Israel seized control of the Rafah border crossing, one of the main entry points for aid, forcing it to close. The Kerem Shalom crossing technically remained open, according to Israel, but aid groups said military operations in the vicinity of the crossing made it impossible to transport and distribute supplies.

title: US floating aid pier begins operating
description: The first aid delivery to Gaza via the US-built floating aid pier is completed. The pier is heavily criticised as a costly and ineffective distraction that won't address widespread hunger in Gaza.

title: No casulaties reported
description: Israeli helicopters fire on people waiting for aid near the beach in northern Gaza, shortly after the American aid pier opened. No casualties were reported.

title: No casulaties reported
description: Israeli artillery fire lands near people waiting for aid deliveries near the new American aid pier. No casualties were reported.

title: 15 killed
description: Israeli airstrike hits a warehouse used for food aid, killing at least 15 people outside, including women and children.

title: The International Court of Justice issues a third set of provisional measures
description: The ICJ orders Israel to halt the Rafah offensive and open the Rafah crossing to allow entry of aid. The court notes previous orders that required the "unhindered provision at scale by all concerned of urgently needed basic services and humanitarian assistance".

title: 9 killed
description: Israeli artillery fire hits people waiting for aid on Salah al-Din Street in Rafah. Sources say at least nine people were killed.

title: 8 killed, 12 wounded
description: Israeli airstrike hits people securing aid delivery at an UNRWA building used to distribute aid, killing at least eight people and injuring 12. Aid committee members and other civilians waiting to receive aid were among those killed and injured.

title: 10 killed, 22 injured
description: Israeli airstrike hits people securing aid delivery and people waiting for aid. Sources vary on the number of wounded, from unreported to up to 22. We recorded 22 wounded.
sources:
ACLED
Reuters

title: 3 killed, 3 wounded
description: Israeli airstrike near food distribution centre kills civilian aid committee members and people waiting for aid. Sources report several wounded. We recorded three.

title: 10 killed
description: Israeli fire, likely from artillery, killed people collecting water near a mosque in Gaza City.

title: 3 killed
description: Israeli airstrike hits people waiting for aid near Khan Younis.

title: US floating aid pier shut down
description: After just two tricky months of use, the US officially shut down the aid pier on 17 July. It ended up delivering the equivalent of one day's worth of food at a cost of $230 million.

title: 1 killed
description: Israeli drone strike hits a bakery in Deir al-Balah.

title: 1 wounded
description: Israeli airstrike injured at least one person collecting water near a mosque in Gaza City.

title: 8 killed, 2 wounded
description: Israeli airstrike killed civilians waiting for bread at a stand outside an UNRWA shelter in Jabalia. Sources report eight killed and others wounded. We recorded two wounded.

title: 3 killed, 2 wounded
description: Israeli airstrike hit people outside a bakery in Gaza City. Sources report three killed and others wounded. We recorded two wounded.

title: 3 wounded
description: Israeli airstrike hit people outside a bakery in Gaza City. Sources report between one and four people wounded. We recorded three.

title: 6 killed, 24 wounded
description: Israeli airstrike hit people outside a bakery in al-Mawasi, which Israeli authorities had declared a "humanitarian zone", killing at least six, including two children. Reports say dozens of others were injured. The Israeli military said they were targeting a senior Islamic Jihad militant.

title: First total siege of Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun
description: Israel begins blocking the entry of all aid into the northernmost areas of Gaza ahead of a major military operation. The total siege last from 2 October to 7 November

title: 3 killed
description: Israeli airstrike hit a water tanker and people collecting water in Jabalia. Sources estimate three killed.

title: Israeli military launches major operation in Jabalia, Beit Lahia, and Beit Hanoun
description: The siege and assault appear to match the description and objectives of the "General's Plan", a strategy proposed by a group of retired military officers who advocated laying siege to the north to force those who remained, whether civilians or militants, to "surrender or starve".

title: 8 killed, 2 wounded
description: Israeli drone strike hit people collecting water in Rafah. Sources do not specify the number of people injured. We recorded two.

title: 10 killed, 40 wounded
description: Israeli airstrike hit an UNRWA centre as civilians waited for aid distribution. Sources report at least 40 wounded.

title: 6 killed, 2 wounded
description: An Israeli airstrike hit people collecting water in Jabalia. Sources say six killed and others wounded. We recorded two wounded.

title: 11 killed, 2 wounded
description: Two Israeli airstrikes in rapid succession hit a vehicle near a mosque where aid was being distributed, killing civilian aid committee volunteers and people waiting for assistance.

title: First aid delivery to North Gaza since 2 October
description: WFP is able dispatch a convoy to North Gaza with food for the first time in over a month. The goods are offloaded by desperate people before they reach their destination.

title: 2 killed, 3 wounded
description: Israeli fire, reportedly from tanks, hit people collecting water in Jabalia. Reports say several wounded. We recorded three.

title: 5 killed, 2 wounded
description: An Israeli strike, likely either drone or tank fire, hit a group of people near an aid warehouse. Reports say five killed and others wounded. We recorded two wounded.

title: Second aid delivery to North Gaza since 2 October
description: WFP delivers two trucks of food and water to an UNRWA shelter in Beit Hanoun. It had planned to deliver 14, but Israeli authorisation delays and other challenges led to its reduction in size.

title: No reported casualties
description: Israeli artillery shelling or airstrikes hit the area around an UNRWA shelter shortly after a World Food Programme convoy delivered aid. On 12 November, Israeli troops surrounded the shelter, forced people to leave, and then set the shelter on fire. There were no reported casualties from the initial strikes. However, two people were reportedly killed and others wounded during the forced evacuation.

title: 6 killed, 10 wounded
description: Israeli airstrike hit a soup kitchen inside the Israeli-declared humanitarian safe zone in al-Mawasi. Early reports say four wounded, and later reports say 10. We recorded 10.

title: Ceasefire begins
description: After 470 days of brutal Israeli military assualt and siege, Israel and Hamas agree to a three-phase ceasefire deal. Although, whether the deal will lead to a permanent end to the war is highly uncertain. We recorded no attacks on people seeking aid during the ceasefire. However, we did record several attacks on local police guarding aid convoys during this period.

title: Israel imposes total siege on Gaza
description: Israel closes all crossings into Gaza, blocking humanitarian aid and commercial goods. The siege is announced just after the beginning of the Muslim holy month of Ramadan. Previously, an average of 600 trucks had been entering Gaza per day during the ceasefire.

title: Israel withdraws from ceasefire
description:
The Israeli military launches a massive wave of airstrikes across Gaza, killing over 400 Palestinians, ending the ceasefire that last for nearly two months. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warns that the airstrikes are "only the beginning".

Read more

title: World Central Kitchen runs out of food
description: The NGO WCK, a major supplier of food in Gaza, announces that it has run out of supplies to cook meals and bake bread.

title: 1 killed, 2 wounded
description: Israeli airstrike hit a soup kitchen in a tent.

title: 1 killed, 3 wounded

title: 2 killed
description: Bomb dropped from Israeli quadcopter drone killed two carrying bags of flour.

title: Israel allows limited aid supplies to enter Gaza
description: For the first time since 2 March, Israel agrees to allow some aid to enter Gaza. The number of trucks is limited, and the aid is only allowed into the south. In the following days, a handful of bakeries temporarily begin operating again, but many aid trucks are looted by desperate people.

title: 10 killed, 60 wounded
description: Israeli airstrike or drone strike hit a bakery. Sources vary on the number of wounded, but reliable sources and video evidence suggest at least 60 wounded. We recorded 10 killed and 60 wounded.
sources:
OCHA
Al Ghad
Quds
Al Mayadeen

title: 2 killed
description: One of three Israeli strikes within 10 minutes in Khan Younis hit a bakery, killing two.

title: 10 killed, 5 wounded
description: A series of Israeli airstrikes targeting civilian aid committee members escorting an aid convoy killed volunteers and bystanders. Sources report 10 killed and a large number wounded. We recorded five wounded.

title: Gaza Humanitarian Foundation begins operating
description: From the beginning, food distribution at GHF sites are marked by chaos and violence. Before it started operating, the UN and numerous international NGOs warned that the GHF's militarised food distribution model was dangerous, likely violated international law, and served Israel's military and political interests.

title: 18 killed, 22 wounded
description: At least 40 casualties after Israeli airstrike hit a warehouse where, reportedly, civil police and local families were selling flour at standard prices after confiscating it from commercial traders who were selling it at inflated prices.

title: 3 killed
description: Israeli forces, including troops and artillery or naval ships, fired on civilians waiting for aid trucks from the Zikim crossing, including TNH contributor Hani Qarmoot. At least three killed, including a boy of about 10 years old.
